item.title: Cmd.exe
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[ul]My school is completely access restricted, but I managed to get cmd.exe. It’s rather simple…

[list]
[li]Open Firefox.[/li]
[li]Go to file:///c:/WINDOWS/system32/[/li]
[li]Click cmd.exe – It’ll ask you to download it.[/li]
[li]Save to Desktop or wherever accessable.[/li]
[/list]

Enjoy.[/ul]

Read full topic

The best way to do it is by signing up to 110mb.com and putting the source code for bats on a HTML page,
All you do in school is copy and paste it into notepad
and save into your area as “homework.bat” you need the “” otherwise it saves as homework.bat.txt and wont work.

ANOTHER THING THAT WORKS IN SCHOOL ARE .VBS FILES.

item.title: Cmd.exe
item.dc:creator: @Jellybean732 Jellybean732
item.description:
@Jellybean732 wrote:

I had this problem at my school. The Command Prompt was disabled but batch files weren’t so, if this is the case, just use batch files. If that doesn’t work I have two suggestions:
Insert and Windows CD in you school computer and reinstall the command prompt or alternatively open up the Command Prompt in Notepad (at home or on a non-blocked computer), save it as Homework.txt or something else so your administrator won’t get suspicious and then rename it as cmd.exe and run it.

Hope these work.

EDIT: Sorry, should’ve read other posts before posting :S[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 07, 2008, 06:51:27 AM[/size][hr][quote=“nator123123, post:29, topic:156413”]I believe this works for Windows XP:

http://get.bulletro.com/cmd.exe

download that, put it in a random folder NOT in the windows folder, or just when the Save or Run option pops up, just hit ‘Run’.

Works for me when I dled it :O[/quote]

Well I suppose it would but if your administrator’s going to block cmd.exe it’s pretty obvious that they’re also going to block most downloads and websites as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Cmd.exe
item.dc:creator: @I_Samn_I I Samn I
item.description:
@I_Samn_I wrote:

[quote=“v3-c, post:7, topic:156413”]Theres another way, if you dotn have internet access.

I did this in my college and its very basic bypass of system folder restriction.

Go to desktop, right click and create a new shortcut. In the shortcut path type c:\windows\system32 press enter.
Now open the shortcut and do not click on “cmd” because that will probably have been disabled. Instead theres a backup version on every operating system. Scroll down and you should find “Command” click that instead and it should give you all the basics inclusing Netstat, etc.

Heres a tip: crash half computers at school: or scare noob tech department and teachers: type “netsend * Hi Everybody!! IM watching GAY PORNOO”, ergo, a warning message will pop up on every computer on the netwok with those words. Be carefull because they will know who sent it so quikly abandon the computer and walk away. (best yet do it on your unsuspecting friends computer).

Yeah pretty much I wudnt know if it works for you since I figured that exploit myself when I was back at highschool (college in UK) so we might have different Operating systems, but give it a go.

PS: Gaining system root, I had loads of fun at college. I installed keyloggers on many computers, created dummy local host accounts and pretty much made those account with administrator rights (theres a rpoggie for windows that does that for the network) pretty much have fun exploring - If you have accounts always make dummy accounts! Yeah and if you get the chance download sp0rkeh or somethign similar that swaps your mouse buttons, changd screen background and basicly annoys the shit out of the user, then restart comp and wathc the next user suffer. har har har :)[/quote]

Nice tip. Will try

Read full topic

item.title: Cmd.exe
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

[quote=“Graham, post:24, topic:156413”][quote author=magma828 link=topic=213390.msg2050019#msg2050019 date=1202876054]
I found out that i can execute .jar files, so is there a java script i could use to change rights or mess about etc…?
[/quote]

Java != JavaScript

Btw, as far as I know, it is impossible to block COMMAND.COM. However, you cannot access it in your case because it is 64-bit Vista, COMMAND.COM is 16-bit for old applications that need it. 64-bit Vista no longer supports 16-bit apps.[/quote]
vista doesn’t really support anything but ‘internet explorer’

Read full topic

item.title: Cmd.exe
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

On another topic

I found out that i can execute .jar files, so is there a java script i could use to change rights or mess about etc…?

Java != JavaScript

Btw, as far as I know, it is impossible to block COMMAND.COM. However, you cannot access it in your case because it is 64-bit Vista, COMMAND.COM is 16-bit for old applications that need it. 64-bit Vista no longer supports 16-bit apps.

Read full topic

item.title: Cmd.exe
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“person1936, post:21, topic:156413”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=213390.msg2037613#msg2037613 date=1202427890]
Open notepad type: ‘Command.com’ (without quotes)

Click file, click save as and call it ‘Command.bat’. Click ‘save as type’ and then choose ‘All Files’
Click save. Double click to execute and it will open Command.com, (same as CMD.EXE basically)

If you can’t do this because it blocked do it at home and put on a flash drive.

hope I helped
[/quote]
no the code-- like i type that an it says the synthinatix of the command are incorrect
P.S. im using windows vista ultimant 64-bit[/quote]

Not sure if vista is the same (different names etc…)

If your in xp or below go to my computer, go to C:\WINDOWS (the C:\ would be the drive that your OS is on) then go to C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32, scroll down and you will see CMD.EXE, take this on a flash drive, this might work.

Read full topic

item.title: Cmd.exe
item.dc:creator: @JukuG JukuG
item.description:
@JukuG wrote:

[quote=“fatcat, post:16, topic:156413”]Hey,
I’m currently at school now and they block everything ¬.¬
Where theres a way theres a will my friend!
IF you want to go on any site in school then use this website —> http://mirror.alexrichter.co.uk/poxy
What that is, is a web proxy, but the blockers don’t block is because its called POXY not PROXY.
And only its a ‘Privte’ Proxy which means very little people know about it or use it so, theres a very, very strong chance it isnt blocked.

As For CMD.exe
You can have a lot of fun with that programme. You can do almost anything on a computer with restricted rights with it.
As for getting on it if its blocked. YOU CANT.
The only way to get on “CMD.exe” is by changing the title using the title command and have a list on premade code in a notepad file. Thats what i used to do.
If you want to use Command.com which is basically exactly the same just slower and designed for older versions of windows.
if you got lots of restrictions do this…

Open up a text editor, such as notepad or microsoft word.
Type in this code

@echo off
color 0f
title Google (So the admins dont get suspisious, but you can put what ever you want!)
start command.com

You might want to look up some CMD commands, theres loads

IF you wana make your self admin just type this into command.com 

NET USER [ACCOUNT NAME] /DOMAIN /ADD

The code above makes a new account so dont use your exsisting one!

Have Fun and hope i helped:D[/quote]

Thanks.

Read full topic
